definition: stuck in the old ways (idiom); refusing to acknowledge new ideas/stagnating and conservative
happening/instance/reason/cause/intentional/former/old/friend/therefore/hence/(of people) to die, dead
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
surname Bu
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
surname Feng
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters

sentences.english: Most adults do stop feeding their minds.
sentences.chinese: 大多數成年人確實都故步自封起來。

sentences.english: Are complacent or insurance to survive?
sentences.chinese: 是故步自封還是險中求生？

definition: (idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
to cherish the outmoded and preserve the outworn (idiom); conservative/stickler for tradition
hidebound by convention (idiom)
ridiculous self-importance (idiom); arrogance
to shut one's eyes and stop one's ears/out of touch with reality/to bury one's head in the sand
to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
conservative/reactionary
to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
lit. Yelang thinks highly of itself (idiom)/fig. foolish conceit
stuck and not moving forward (idiom); stagnant/in a rut/at a standstill
lit. to draw a line on the ground to keep within (idiom)/fig. to impose restrictions on oneself
complacent/self-satisfied
lit. to view the sky from the bottom of a well (idiom); ignorant and narrow-minded
to close the passes and seal off the country/to close a country to exclude foreign contact
abreast of modern developments/to keep up with the times/progressive/timely
